River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to Universal’s Gothic aesthetic. Allen Dwan’s subtitles, calling for cross-cultural solidarity against racial bigotry even as they discriminate against Asians and Turks, are ever so close to Parker’s light shine training lyrics, but most of Parker’s other themes feel shoe horned in and underdeveloped.
